The Pedro Manhattan is a great choice for those who enjoy the classic Manhattan cocktail but want to try something a little different, with a unique flavor profile.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
2. Add 50ml of bourbon, 20ml of Pedro Ximenez, 1 dash of Angostura Bitters and 2 dashes of Peychaud's Bitters.
3. Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Penicillin
cocktails.description: Smoky scotch cocktail with honey, ginger, and lemon.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Muddle 3 pieces of fresh ginger in a top tin.
2. Add blended scotch, lemon juice, and honey syrup into a shaker with ice.
3. Shake well.
4. Double strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
5. Float Islay scotch on top and garnish with a ginger candy.

cocktails.name: Perfect Martini
cocktails.description: This is a combination of the Dry and Sweet Martini cocktails that makes a good pre-dinner cocktail. The amount of gin can be varied according to your taste.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
2. Add 60ml of gin, 10ml of dry vermouth and 10ml of red vermouth.
3. Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with a lemon peel and a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Pete's Word
cocktails.description: A smoky take on the Last Word with Laphroaig, maraschino liqueur and green Chartreuse.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add 30ml of Laphroaig, 30ml of maraschino liqueur, 30ml of green Chartreuse and 30ml of lime juice.
3. Shake and strain into a chilled wine glass.

cocktails.name: Piña Clara
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, lighter take on the classic tropical profile. This cocktail combines white rum with clear coconut water and pineapple syrup for a crisp, refreshing, and translucent summer drink.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add white rum, pineapple syrup, and coconut water into a mixing glass with ice.
2. Stir gently to combine and chill without over-diluting.
3. Strain the mixture into the prepared collins glass filled with fresh ice.
4. Garnish with a fresh pineapple wedge or leaf.

cocktails.name: Piña Colada
cocktails.description: The ultimate tropical indulgence. A creamy, sweet blend of white rum, coconut cream, and pineapple juice that transports you straight to a Caribbean beach.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add white rum, coconut syrup (or cream), and pineapple juice into a blender.
2. Add a scoop of crushed ice.
3. Blend the mixture on high speed until it reaches a smooth, slushy consistency.
4. Pour the contents into a chilled hurricane glass.
5. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Pink Lady
cocktails.description: A classic Prohibition-era cocktail known for its beautiful rosy hue and silky texture. The combination of gin, grenadine, and egg white creates a sophisticated, creamy finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine gin, strawberry syrup, grenadine, and egg white in a shaker without ice (dry shake) to emulsify the egg.
2. Fill the shaker with ice cubes and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
3. Double strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass to achieve a smooth foam.
4. Garnish with a maraschino cherry on top.

cocktails.name: Pisco Punch
cocktails.description: Fruity highball of pisco with pineapple and citrus.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add pisco, pineapple juice, lime juice, and simple syrup into a shaker with ice.
2. Shake well.
3. Strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
4. Top with soda water and garnish with a pineapple wedge.

cocktails.name: Pisco Sour
cocktails.description: Peruvian classic with pisco, lime, and creamy egg white foam.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add pisco, lime juice, simple syrup, and egg white into a shaker without ice.
2. Dry shake to mix.
3. Add ice and shake again until chilled.
4. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
5. Garnish the foam with a few drops of Angostura bitters.

cocktails.name: Planter's Punch
cocktails.description: Jamaican rum punch with citrus, grenadine, and a touch of bitters.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add rum, orange juice, pineapple juice, lime juice, and grenadine into a shaker with ice.
2. Shake well.
3. Pour into a highball glass and top with soda water.
4. Dash bitters on top and garnish with a pineapple slice.

cocktails.name: Popinjay
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and spirit-forward cocktail that balances the warmth of Cognac with the herbal bitterness of Cynar and the botanical complexity of Punt e Mes.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine Cognac, Cynar, and Punt e Mes in a mixing glass filled with ice.
2. Stir gently for about 20-30 seconds until well-chilled.
3. Strain the mixture into the chilled glass.
4. Express the oils of an orange zest over the drink and garnish.

cocktails.name: Porn Star Martini
cocktails.description: An exotic and visually stunning modern classic, featuring vibrant passion fruit flavors and served with a celebratory sidecar of sparkling wine.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add vanilla vodka, passion fruit liqueur, passion fruit syrup, lime juice, and vanilla syrup into a shaker with ice.
2. Shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker feels very cold.
3. Fine strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with half a passion fruit floating on top.
5. Serve with a chilled shot of Prosecco or Champagne on the side.

cocktails.name: Porto Flip
cocktails.description: A velvety and decadent dessert cocktail that combines the richness of Port wine and Cognac with a creamy texture from a fresh egg yolk.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add Cognac, Tawny Port, and egg yolk into a shaker.
2. Dry shake (without ice) first to emulsify the egg yolk.
3. Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously again until well-chilled.
4. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass or small goblet.
5. Dust the surface with freshly grated nutmeg for aroma.

cocktails.name: Purgatory a la Française
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward twist on the classic Purgatory. This French-inspired version balances the boldness of Cognac with the herbal sweetness of Yellow Chartreuse and the bitter depth of Punt e Mes, finished with a subtle smoky whisper of Islay Scotch.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine the Cognac, Yellow Chartreuse, Punt e Mes, and Islay Scotch Whiskey in a mixing glass.
2. Fill the mixing glass with ice cubes.
3. Stir gently for about 20-30 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into a chilled Nick and Nora glass.
5. Garnish with a lemon twist to add a bright citrus aroma.

cocktails.name: Rabo de Galo
cocktails.description: A classic Brazilian staple that translates to 'Tail of the Rooster'. This drink is a complex, bittersweet harmony of Cachaça and herbal amaro, offering a deep and punchy flavor profile that is both rustic and refined.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add Cachaça, Red Vermouth, and Cynar into a mixing glass filled with ice.
2. Optionally add 2 dashes of Angostura Bitters for extra complexity.
3. Stir well for 20 seconds to achieve the perfect dilution.
4. Strain the liquid into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
5. Garnish with an orange twist to release essential oils over the drink.

cocktails.name: Rafaello
cocktails.description: Inspired by the famous confectionery, this cocktail is a decadent dessert in a glass. It combines the creaminess of Irish Cream with tropical coconut and sweet vanilla for a silky, indulgent treat.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Rim a snifter glass with coconut flakes by lightly wetting the edge and dipping it into the flakes.
2. Combine Irish Cream, Coconut Liqueur, and Vanilla Syrup in a shaker.
3. Add ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until very cold.
4. Double strain the mixture into the prepared snifter glass.
5. Sprinkle any remaining coconut flakes on top for an extra touch of texture.

cocktails.name: Ramos Gin Fizz
cocktails.description: A frothy gin fizz with citrus, cream, and a hint of orange flower water.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add gin, lemon juice, lime juice, simple syrup, cream, egg white, orange flower water, and vanilla extract into a shaker without ice.
2. Dry shake for two minutes vigorously.
3. Add ice and shake again until chilled.
4. Strain into a Collins glass without ice.
5. Top with soda water.

cocktails.name: Rattlesnake
cocktails.description: A strong whiskey-based cocktail from the 1930 "The Savoy Cocktail Book." The comment for the drink says "So called because it will either cure Rattlesnake bite, or kill Rattlesnake, and, moreover, make you see double."
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour 60ml of rye whisky and a dash of absinthe into a cocktail shaker without ice.
2. Add 2 teaspoons of lemon juice, 2 teaspoons of simple syrup and half an egg white.
3. Shake vigorously to make the drink frothy.
4. Add ice, shake again, and strain into a cocktail glass.
5. Garnish with a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: Red Hook
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward riff on the Manhattan. This Brooklyn-inspired cocktail balances the spicy kick of rye whiskey with the bittersweet complexity of Punt e Mes and a touch of nutty maraschino.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine the Rye Whisky, Punt e Mes, and Maraschino Liqueur in a mixing glass.
2. Fill the mixing glass with ice cubes.
3. Stir gently with a bar spoon for about 30 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Strain into a chilled glass.
5. Garnish with maraschino cherries on a cocktail pick.

cocktails.name: Red Russian
cocktails.description: A bold and minimalist two-ingredient drink. The neutral profile of vodka allows the deep, sweet, and tart notes of cherry brandy to take center stage for a smooth, dessert-like finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a rocks glass with fresh ice cubes.
2. Pour the Vodka over the ice.
3. Add the Cherry Brandy (or Cherry Liqueur).
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon to combine the ingredients and chill the drink.
5. Serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Redheaded Slut
cocktails.description: A popular and vibrant party shooter. This mix of herbal Jägermeister, sweet peach schnapps, and tart cranberry juice creates a surprisingly balanced and fruity shot.
cocktails.instructions:
For 3 ingredients.
1. Fill a cocktail shaker with a generous amount of ice cubes.
2. Pour in the Jägermeister, peach schnapps, and cranberry juice.
3. Shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until the shaker is frosted on the outside.
4. Strain the mixture evenly into three large shot glasses.
5. Garnish with strawberries.

cocktails.name: Remember the Maine
cocktails.description: A Manhattan variation with rye whisky, cherry heering, and a hint of absinthe.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Rinse a chilled cocktail glass with absinthe and discard the excess.
2. Add rye whisky, cherry heering, and red vermouth into a mixing glass with ice.
3. Stir well.
4. Strain into the prepared glass.
5. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Renaissance
cocktails.description: The Renaissance cocktail is a spirit-forward drink characterised by its bittersweet profile and deep complexity. While there are several variations, the most widely recognised classic version is a refined brandy-based drink designed as an aperitif or after-dinner digestif.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Stir all ingredients with ice.
2. Strain into chilled glass.
3. Express orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.

cocktails.name: Right Word
cocktails.description: A floral riff on the Last Word with gin, St. Germain and Lillet Blanc.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add gin, St. Germain, Lillet Blanc and half a lime.
3. Shake and strain into a chilled wine glass.

cocktails.name: Roasted Toasted Almond
cocktails.description: A stronger variation of the "Toasted Almond" with vodka.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a rocks glass with ice.
2. Add 30ml of amaretto, 30ml of coffee liqueur and 30ml of vodka, and top with cream.
3. Stir slightly.

cocktails.name: Rob Roy
cocktails.description: The drink is a variation of the Manhattan cocktail with Scotch whisky. It is named for the Scottish folk hero Robert Roy MacGregor, the "Scottish Robin Hood." This cocktail first appeared in New York around 1890.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
2. Add 45ml of Scotch Whiskey, 25ml of red vermouth and 1 dash of Angostura Bitters.
3. Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Robinson
cocktails.description: A refreshing and tropical long drink that combines the creamy sweetness of coconut with the crisp sparkle of lemon-lime soda. Perfect for easy sipping on a warm day.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour 60ml of Coconut Liqueur over the ice.
3. Top up the glass with 150ml of Sprite.
4. Gently stir to combine the ingredients.
5. Garnish with lime slices and a sprig of fresh mint.

cocktails.name: Rome is Burning
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and bold sparkling cocktail that balances the depth of Cognac and bitter vermouth with a touch of pomegranate and effervescent Prosecco.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add Cognac, Punt e Mes, Grenadine, and Creole bitters into a mixing glass filled with ice.
2. Stir well until chilled.
3. Strain the mixture into a chilled coupe glass.
4. Top with 45ml of Prosecco.
5. Garnish with a Maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Rose
cocktails.description: An IBA official pre-dinner cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a mixing glass with ice.
2. Add 60ml of dry vermouth, 30ml of kirsch and 3 dashes of strawberry syrup.
3. Stir well and strain into a cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Rosé Spritz
cocktails.description: A light and refreshing floral spritz that elegantly balances premium vodka with the delicate notes of rosé wine and the bright sweetness of pink lemonade.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a wine glass with 120g of ice cubes.
2. Pour 120ml of Prosecco.
3. Top the glass with 120ml of pink lemonade.
4. Stir gently.

cocktails.name: Rossini
cocktails.description: A sophisticated Italian classic and variation of the Bellini, featuring vibrant strawberry purée topped with crisp, chilled Prosecco.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Purée or muddle 50g of fresh strawberries until smooth.
2. Pour the strawberry purée into a chilled champagne flute.
3. Gently pour 100ml of chilled Prosecco into the glass.
4. Stir very slowly with a bar spoon to lift the purée and blend.
5. Garnish with a fresh strawberry on the rim.

cocktails.name: Roy Rogers
cocktails.description: A popular non-alcoholic mocktail that combines the deep caramel notes of cola with the sweet fruitiness of grenadine.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with 120g of ice cubes.
2. Add 10ml of grenadine syrup over the ice.
3. Top with 200ml of cola.
4. Stir well to ensure the syrup is mixed from the bottom.
5. Garnish with a maraschino cherry for a classic finish.

cocktails.name: Rum & Cola
cocktails.description: A classic, refreshing highball that perfectly balances the sweetness of cola with the crisp notes of white rum, accented by a bright citrus kick from fresh lime.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with fresh ice cubes.
2. Pour 60ml of White Rum over the ice.
3. Top up the glass with 120ml of chilled Cola.
4. Squeeze two lime wedges into the drink and drop them in (optional).
5. Stir gently with a bar spoon to combine the flavors without losing carbonation.
6. Garnish with two fresh lime slices and serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Rum Buck
cocktails.description: Cocktails from the "buck" family use ginger ale or beer and citrus juice with a base liquor.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a collins glass with ice.
2. Pour 50ml of base liquor over the ice.
3. Add lime juice, and top with ginger ale or ginger beer.

cocktails.name: Rum Eggnog
cocktails.description: A rich, creamy wine drink featuring Egg White, Dry Sherry, Spiced Rum—dessert-like, smooth, and indulgent. Garnished with nutmeg.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add dry sherry, spiced rum, cream, milk, an egg white, and demerara sugar syrup to a shaker and dry shake for 15-20 seconds.
2. Add ice and shake again until well chilled.
3. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
4. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and an optional cinnamon stick.

cocktails.name: Rum Old Fashioned
cocktails.description: A variation of the classic "Old Fashioned" cocktail with aged rum instead of bourbon or rye. Some recipes also suggest adding a small amount of high-proof overproof rum.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Place a sugar cube in a rocks glass and saturate it with Angostura bitters and, optionally, orange bitters.
2. Add a few dashes of plain water, and stir until the sugar is dissolved, and add 45ml of quality aged rum and, optionally, 10ml of overproof rum.
3. Add some ice cubes and stir again.
4. Garnish with an orange or lemon peel, and squeeze it a bit to release the oils.

cocktails.name: Rum Rickey
cocktails.description: "Rickey" is a family of drinks made with some base liquor, lime juice and sparkling water. One of the most popular is the "Gin Rickey", which is made with gin.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice.
2. Add 50ml of white rum and 30ml of lime juice. Top with soda water.
3. Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Rumplesnuggler
cocktails.description: A comforting and decadent winter warmer that combines the rich sweetness of hot chocolate with creamy Baileys and a sharp, refreshing peppermint kick from Rumple Minze.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Prepare your hot chocolate in a separate container and ensure it is steaming hot.
2. Pour the Baileys Irish Cream and Rumple Minze peppermint schnapps into an Irish coffee glass.
3. Fill the remainder of the glass with the hot chocolate and stir gently to combine.
4. Top with a generous dollop of whipped cream.

cocktails.name: Rusty Nail
cocktails.description: A classic, slow-sipping cocktail that highlights the smoky notes of Scotch whisky, perfectly balanced by the sweet honey and herbal complexity of Drambuie liqueur.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a rocks glass with large ice cubes.
2. Pour the Scotch whisky and Drambuie directly over the ice.
3. Stir gently for about 10-15 seconds to chill and slightly dilute the drink.
4. Garnish with a fresh lemon twist by expressing the oils over the glass.

cocktails.name: Salty Dog
cocktails.description: The Salty Dog is a lot friendlier than it sounds. This classic cocktail is a modified Greyhound (gin or vodka with grapefruit juice) that is differentiated by the drink’s salted rim. But that salt gives this drink its own identity.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Wet the rim of a highball glass and dip it in coarse salt.
2. Fill the glass with ice, then add the gin (or vodka) and grapefruit juice and stir gently to combine.
3. Garnish with a grapefruit slice.

cocktails.name: San Francisco
cocktails.description: This little-known cocktail first appeared in 1937 in the "Café Royal Cocktail Book", published by the UK Bartenders Guild.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Shake all ingredients with ice.
2. Strain into an ice-filled glass
3. Garnish with a pineapple wedge.

cocktails.name: Sangria
cocktails.description: A refreshing drink that is popular during the summer, especially in Spain and Portugal. The ingredients can be varied — you can use white wine instead of red wine and your own choice of fruits, juices, and sparkling water or soda. The drink is named after the Spanish word sangre, which means "blood." The recipe here is for a 1L pitcher. The drink can be refrigerated before serving.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour one bottle of red or white wine into a pitcher.
2. Cut an orange and a lemon into wedges, and slightly squeeze them into the pitcher.
3. Add other fruits (optional).
4. Add 3–4 teaspoons of sugar or honey.
5. Add 5 cl of brandy and, optionally, 200ml of ginger ale or soda if you want the drink to be softer.
6. Before serving, add some ice cubes, stir and strain into glasses. Garnish with fruit slices.

cocktails.name: Sangrita
cocktails.description: A non-alcoholic drink that usually accompanies tequila shots. You drink a shot of Sangrita after taking a shot of tequila. Many variations of the Sangrita recipe exist; the current recipe is not an authentic Mexican version, but the idea is that the drink is popular and easy to make. The recipe here is for a 1L pitcher of Sangrita.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour 600ml of tomato juice and 300ml of orange juice into a pitcher.
2. Add 100ml of lime juice, 20ml of Tabasco and 1–2 teaspoons of pepper and salt.
3. Garnish with an orange slice and celery.

cocktails.name: Santorini
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward cocktail that captures the essence of the Mediterranean. It balances the herbal depth of Red Vermouth with the smoky notes of Scotch, finished with a distinct aromatic touch of Ouzo.
cocktails.instructions:
1. In a mixing glass filled with ice, combine the Red Vermouth, Scotch Whiskey, and Ouzo.
2. Stir the mixture gently for about 20-30 seconds until well-chilled.
3. Strain the liquid into the chilled rocks glass over fresh ice.
4. Garnish with a lemon peel or an olive if desired.

cocktails.name: Sazerac
cocktails.description: The quintessential New Orleans classic. A complex and aromatic masterpiece featuring the spicy kick of rye or cognac, sweetened slightly and brightened by the unique anise aroma of an absinthe rinse.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Rinse a chilled rocks glass with absinthe, swirling to coat the sides, and discard the excess.
2. In a separate mixing glass, muddle the sugar cube with Peychaud's bitters until dissolved.
3. Add the Cognac (or Rye Whiskey) and fill the mixing glass with ice.
4. Stir well until the drink is properly chilled.
5. Strain the mixture into the prepared absinthe-rinsed glass without ice.
6. Express the oils of a lemon twist over the drink and garnish.

cocktails.name: Scarlett O'Hara
cocktails.description: A vibrant and refreshing long drink named after the iconic Southern belle. It combines the unique stone-fruit flavors of Southern Comfort with tart cranberry and lime for a perfectly balanced sip.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Shake all ingredients with ice.
2. Strain into an ice-filled glass.
3. Garnish with lime wedge

cocktails.name: Scotch Point
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward cocktail that balances the smoky depth of Scotch whisky with the bitter-sweet complexity of Punt e Mes and the rich, fruity notes of Ruby Port. A dash of Creole bitters adds a unique spicy finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. In a mixing glass, combine the Scotch whiskey, Punt e Mes, Ruby Port, and Creole bitters.
2. Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir well for about 20-30 seconds until perfectly chilled.
3. Strain the mixture into the prepared rocks glass over fresh ice.
4. Express the oils from a lemon peel over the drink and garnish.

cocktails.name: Screaming Orgasm
cocktails.description: This screaming orgasm shot is a layered delight with vodka,  coffee liqueur, Irish cream, and amaretto.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour coffee liqueur into the base of a shot glass.
2. Layer on Amaretto
3. Carefully add a layer of Irish cream.
4. Top with a layer of vodka.

cocktails.name: Screwdriver
cocktails.description: A world-famous, refreshing highball that perfectly marries the neutrality of vodka with the bright acidity of orange juice. Simple, classic, and an official IBA favorite.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with fresh ice cubes.
2. Pour the vodka into the glass over the ice.
3. Top the glass with orange juice.
4. Stir gently to combine the ingredients without losing the chill.
5. Garnish with a fresh orange slice and serve.

cocktails.name: Sea Breeze
cocktails.description: Cranberry and grapefruit highball spiked with vodka.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice.
2. Add vodka, cranberry juice, and grapefruit juice.
3. Stir briefly.
4. Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Seventh Son
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and aromatic spirit-forward drink that balances the richness of Cognac with floral rose and deep cherry notes, finished with a crisp lager top.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Shake first 3 ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glass.
2. Strain the mixture into the chilled champagne flute.
3. Top slowly with the cold Pilsner lager.
4. Stir very briefly.

cocktails.name: Sex on the Beach
cocktails.description: A classic, easy-drinking highball known for its vibrant layers and refreshing blend of vodka, peach, and tropical fruit juices.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass to the top with fresh ice cubes.
2. Pour the vodka and peach schnapps over the ice.
3. Add the orange juice and cranberry juice.
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon to combine the flavors.
5. Garnish with a fresh orange slice on the rim of the glass.

cocktails.name: Sex With an Alligator (long)
cocktails.description: An eye-catching layered cocktail that features a sweet melon and pineapple base with heavy herbal and almond accents settled at the top and bottom.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add the Midori melon liqueur and pineapple juice to the shaker.
3. Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail (martini) glass.
5. Carefully pour the amaretto down the side of the glass so it sinks to the bottom.
6. Finish by slowly layering the Jägermeister on the very top using the back of a spoon.

cocktails.name: Sex With an Alligator (shot)
cocktails.description: An eye-catching layered cocktail that features a sweet melon and pineapple base with heavy herbal and almond accents settled at the top and bottom.
cocktails.instructions:
For two shots:
1. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add the Midori melon liqueur and pineapple juice to the shaker.
3. Shake vigorously until well-chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail (martini) glass.
5. Carefully pour the Chambord down the side of the glass so it sinks to the bottom.
6. Finish by slowly layering the Jägermeister on the very top using the back of a spoon.

cocktails.name: Sherry Cobbler
cocktails.description: Classic sherry cooler muddled with citrus and berries.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Muddle orange slices and sugar in a cup glass.
2. Add sherry and fill the cup with crushed ice.
3. Stir well.
4. Garnish with orange slices and berries.

cocktails.name: Shirley Temple
cocktails.description: A simple and popular non-alcoholic cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a collins glass with ice cubes.
2. Add 60ml of ginger ale and 60ml of lemonade, or just add 120ml of ginger ale.
3. Add 5ml of grenadine.
4. Stir well and garnish with a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Sidecar
cocktails.description: Cognac sour sweetened with orange liqueur.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add cognac, Cointreau, and lemon juice into a shaker with ice.
2. Shake well.
3. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with an orange twist.

cocktails.name: Silver Bay
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and warming whiskey cocktail that balances the smoky depth of Islay Scotch with the nutty sweetness of chestnut and honey, finished with a hint of spice.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine the Islay Scotch Whiskey, lemon juice, chestnut liqueur, and honey syrup in a heat-resistant glass or mug.
2. Add the whiskey-barrel aged bitters.
3. Pour in the boiling water and stir gently to combine all ingredients.
4. Grate fresh nutmeg over the top for aroma.
5. Serve warm in a cocktail glass or toddy mug.

cocktails.name: Silver Bullet
cocktails.description: A potent and bold combination of gin and kümmel liqueur, designed for those who appreciate a strong, spirit-forward drink with a sharp, clean finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a mixing glass or shaker with ice cubes.
2. Pour in the gin and kümmel liqueur.
3. Stir well for about 20 seconds to ensure the drink is properly chilled and diluted.
4. Strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.
5. Garnish with a fresh lemon twist by expressing the oils over the drink.

cocktails.name: Sin Limites
cocktails.description: A bright rum sour that artfully balances the aromatic warmth of cardamom with crisp white rum, smooth vanilla, and sharp citrus notes.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Muddle the cardamom pods in the bottom of a cocktail shaker to release their essential oils.
2. Add the white rum, lime juice, vanilla syrup, and Strucchi Bitter to the shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously.
4. Double-strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Singapore Sling
cocktails.description: A legendary tropical gin-based punch, famous for its complex fruity profile, vibrant pink hue, and refreshing botanical finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine gin, cherry heering, Cointreau, Benedictine, pineapple juice, lime juice, grenadine, and bitters in a cocktail shaker.
2. Add ice to the shaker and shake thoroughly until the outside of the shaker feels cold.
3. Strain the mixture into a tall highball glass filled with fresh ice.
4. Top up the glass with a splash of soda water for a light fizz.
5. Garnish with a fresh pineapple slice and a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Slippery Nipple
cocktails.description: A very smooth and beautiful shot.
cocktails.instructions:
1. If you use grenadine syrup, pour it on the bottom layer. 
2. Pour 20ml of sambuca into a shooter glass.
3. Carefully pour 20ml of Baileys on top of the sambuca.

cocktails.name: Smoky Whiskey Sour
cocktails.description: A variation of the classic "Whisky Sour" created by Simon Difford for people who like the distinct smoky flavor of Scotch Islay whisky.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine 30ml of Islay single malt Scotch and 30ml of scotch whisky in a cocktail shaker.
2. Add 30ml of lemon juice, 20ml of maple syrup and a dash of Angostura bitters.
3. Add 1 egg white and dry shake without ice.
4. Add ice and shake again.
5. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
6. Garnish with a lemon peel.

cocktails.name: Snakebite
cocktails.description: A classic British pub mix that blends the crispness of apple cider with the body of lager, finished with a sweet touch of blackcurrant.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour 240ml of chilled beer into a pub glass.
2. Gently add 240ml of apple cider to maintain the carbonation.
3. Top with a dash (1 tsp) of Creme de Cassis for flavor and color.
4. Stir very lightly if needed and serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Sneaky Pete
cocktails.description: A bold and creamy variation of the White Russian, swapping vodka for the spicy, robust notes of rye whiskey.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour 30ml of rye whiskey over the ice.
3. Add 30ml of coffee liqueur.
4. Pour in 30ml of milk and stir well to combine.

cocktails.name: Snowball
cocktails.description: A festive and nostalgic favorite in the UK, this 'Winter Warmer' is sweet, fizzy, and pleasantly creamy.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour 60ml of egg liqueur into an ice-filled Collins glass.
2. Optionally, squeeze in 15ml of fresh lime juice to balance the sweetness.
3. Carefully fill the rest of the glass with lemonade.
4. Stir gently to mix the thick liqueur with the soda without losing the fizz.

cocktails.name: South Side
cocktails.description: Herbal gin sour brightened with mint.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, and mint leaves into a shaker with ice.
2. Shake well.
3. Fine strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with a mint leaf.

cocktails.name: Spiced Apple-Bourbon Punch
cocktails.description: A bright whiskey sour balancing Apple Cider, Bourbon, Apple Brandy with fresh citrus and a touch of sweetness for a crisp, refreshing sip.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine apple cider, bourbon, apple brandy, lemon juice, demerara syrup, and bitters in a cocktail shaker.
2. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously.
3. Strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
4. Garnish with two whole cloves to add a seasonal aroma.

cocktails.name: Spiced Rum Milk Punch
cocktails.description: A creamy, comforting punch blending spiced rum with milk, vanilla, and warm winter spices for a smooth dessert-like finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients into a cocktail shaker.
2. Add one medium or two small ice cubes to the cocktail shaker and shake until the ice fully melts.
3. Without a strainer, pour the chilled and aerated drink into a glass with ice.

cocktails.name: Spicy Fifty
cocktails.description: An elegant yet bold vanilla vodka sour that perfectly balances the floral notes of elderflower with the sharp heat of fresh red chili.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Place a slice of red chili pepper in the bottom of a cocktail shaker and muddle gently to release the heat.
2. Add the vanilla vodka, elderflower cordial, lime juice, and honey syrup.
3. Fill the shaker with ice and shake hard until well-chilled.
4. Fine strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass to remove chili seeds and pulp.
5. Garnish with a fresh red chili slice.

cocktails.name: Spritz Veneziano
cocktails.description: An IBA official sparkling cocktail. Prosecco is recommended for the sparkling wine.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a wine glass with ice.
2. Add 90ml of sparkling wine and 60ml of Aperol.
3. Top with a splash of soda water.
4. Garnish with an orange slice.

cocktails.name: Squashed Frog
cocktails.description: Despite its name, this layered shot is very mild and sweet.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour 5ml of grenadine into a shooter glass.
2. Carefully add 30ml of melon liqueur and 15ml of egg liqueur on top using a bar spoon.

cocktails.name: Squashed Irish Frog
cocktails.description: Despite its name, this layered shot is very mild and sweet.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour 5ml of grenadine into a shooter glass.
2. Carefully add 30ml of melon liqueur and 15ml of egg liqueur on top using a bar spoon.

cocktails.name: Stay Sober
cocktails.description: A delightful, refreshing non-alcoholic cocktail. The ratio of ingredients can be varied according to your taste.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour 30ml of apple juice and 30ml of cranberry juice.
3. Top with ginger beer.

cocktails.name: Stinger
cocktails.description: Brandy and crème de menthe served straight up.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add cognac and white crème de menthe into a mixing glass with ice.
2. Stir well.
3. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Stone Fence
cocktails.description: A historic American colonial classic that combines the robust warmth of rye whiskey with the crisp, refreshing profile of apple cider. This version is enhanced with a dash of aromatic bitters and a fresh mint garnish for a complex, spirit-forward experience.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a tall pub glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour 60ml of Rye Whisky over the ice.
3. Add 1 dash of Angostura Bitters.
4. Top the glass with approximately 440ml of Apple Cider.
5. Stir gently to combine the ingredients without losing carbonation.
6. Garnish with a fresh sprig of mint and serve immediately.

cocktails.name: Strawberry Colada
cocktails.description: A vibrant and fruity twist on the traditional Piña Colada. This tropical delight blends white rum and creamy coconut with the sweet, tart flavor of fresh strawberries, creating a lush pink cocktail perfect for summer sipping.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a blender with 150g of ice or crushed ice.
2. Add 30ml of White Rum and 20ml of Strawberry Liqueur.
3. Add 50g of fresh strawberries (or strawberry puree), 30ml of Coconut Cream, and 90ml of Pineapple Juice.
4. Blend on high speed until the mixture reaches a smooth, slushy consistency.
5. Pour the contents into a hurricane or chilled goblet glass.
6. Garnish with a strawberry.
7. Optionally, top with a dollop of whipped cream for extra decadence.

cocktails.name: Strawberry Daiquiri
cocktails.description: A bright rum sour that perfectly balances fruity strawberry liqueur with the crispness of white rum and fresh lime. A pinch of salt and black pepper enhances the berry profile for a complex finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add the white rum, strawberry liqueur, lime juice, and rich simple syrup into a cocktail shaker.
2. Add a pinch of salt and a light crack of black pepper to the shaker.
3. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Double strain the mixture into the chilled coupe glass.
5. Garnish with a fresh strawberry on the rim.

cocktails.name: Strawberry Margarita
cocktails.description: A luscious and bold twist on the classic Margarita, combining the earthy notes of Tequila Blanco with sweet strawberries and the orange accents of Cointreau.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine the fresh strawberries, tequila blanco, Cointreau, and lime juice in a blender.
2. Add the ice to the mixture.
3. Blend until the texture is perfectly smooth and frozen.
4. Optional: Rim your margarita glasses with salt or sugar if desired.
5. Pour the blended cocktail into the prepared glasses.
6. Finish with a strawberry garnish on each glass.

cocktails.name: Streamtini
cocktails.description: A sophisticated spirit-forward cocktail that balances the botanical notes of vodka with the sweet, tart profile of blueberry schnapps and cranberry juice. It is a deep, aromatic drink designed for slow sipping.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a cocktail shaker with 150g of ice.
2. Pour 30ml of Vodka, 30ml of Blueberry Schnapps, and 60ml of Cranberry Juice into the shaker.
3. Shake vigorously.
4. Strain into the chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Suburban
cocktails.description: A robust and complex cocktail reminiscent of an Old Fashioned. It features a rich blend of bourbon, dark rum, and port wine, accented by the aromatic depth of two types of bitters.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a mixing glass with ice.
2. Add 50ml of bourbon, 25ml of aged dark rum, and 25ml of aged tawny port wine.
3. Add 1 dash of Angostura bitters and 1 dash of orange bitters.
4. Stir the ingredients well for about 20-30 seconds to achieve proper dilution and temperature.
5. Strain the liquid into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
6. Garnish with a twist of orange peel.

cocktails.name: Suffering Bastard
cocktails.description: A refreshing and historic highball that combines the punch of gin and brandy with the zesty kick of lime and the spicy effervescence of ginger beer.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add 30ml of gin, 30ml of cognac (or brandy), 15ml of lime juice, and 2 dashes of Angostura bitters into a cocktail shaker with ice.
2. Shake briefly to chill the ingredients.
3. Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
4. Top the glass with 90ml of ginger beer.
5. Garnish with a fresh mint sprig and a slice of orange.

cocktails.name: Suze & Tonic
cocktails.description: Suze & Tonic is a refreshing cocktail with a relatively low alcohol level compared to gin.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour the Suze over the ice into a Collins glass
2. Top with tonic.
3. Stir briefly.
4. Squeeze a lemon or lime wedge into the drink, then drop it in.

cocktails.name: Swimming Pool
cocktails.description: A tropical cocktail with vodka, rum, coconut and pineapple flavors.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a shaker with ice.
2. Pour 30ml of vodka and 60ml of white rum.
3. Add 15ml of cream, 30ml of coconut milk and 60ml of pineapple juice.
4. Shake well and strain into a hurricane glass filled with ice.
5. Pour 15ml of blue curacao on the top.
6. Garnish with a pineapple wedge.

cocktails.name: Symphony
cocktails.description: A custom mix of gin, maraschino liqueur, green Chartreuse and a smoky Laphroaig float.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a mixing glass with ice.
2. Pour 30ml of gin, 20ml of maraschino liqueur, 20ml of green Chartreuse and 20ml of lemon juice.
3. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
4. Float 5ml of Laphroaig on top.

cocktails.name: Szarlotka
cocktails.description: A simple Polish cocktail pairing Żubrówka with apple juice and cinnamon.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a rocks glass with ice.
2. Pour 60ml of Żubrówka and 120ml of apple juice.
3. Add a pinch of grated cinnamon and stir gently.
4. Garnish with a cinnamon stick and an apple slice.

cocktails.name: Tarzan
cocktails.description: A refreshing long drink of gin, Campari and pineapple juice topped with soda.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a collins glass with ice.
2. Pour 30ml of gin and 30ml of Campari.
3. Add 45ml of pineapple juice, 15ml of sugar syrup and 15ml of lemon juice.
4. Top with soda water and stir gently.

cocktails.name: Temperance Punch
cocktails.description: A refreshing and vibrant non-alcoholic punch that balances the sweetness of grape and orange juices with a sharp citrus kick and a bubbly finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with 150g of ice.
2. Pour in 60ml of grape juice, 30ml of orange juice, and 30ml of lemon juice.
3. Top up the glass with soda water.
4. Stir gently to combine the flavors without losing the carbonation.

cocktails.name: Tequila Rickey
cocktails.description: A crisp, sugar-free classic from the Rickey family that highlights the earthy notes of tequila with fresh lime and sparkling water.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add 150g of ice to a highball glass.
2. Pour 50ml of tequila and 30ml of lime juice over the ice.
3. Top with 100ml of soda water.
4. Stir briefly and garnish with a fresh lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Tequila Slammer
cocktails.description: An energetic party shooter known for its explosive carbonation and ritualistic serving style, mixing tequila with lemon-lime soda.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour 50ml of Tequila Blanco into a rocks glass.
2. Add 50ml of 7-Up or similar lemon-lime soda.
3. Cover the top of the glass firmly with your hand or a coaster.
4. Slam the glass onto a hard surface to trigger the fizz and drink it immediately while it's foaming.

cocktails.name: Tequila Sunrise
cocktails.description: Tequila and orange highball layered with grenadine.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice.
2. Add tequila and orange juice and stir.
3. Slowly pour grenadine to create a sunrise effect.
4. Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry.

cocktails.name: That's my word
cocktails.description: A floral riff on the Last Word with gin, St. Germain and yellow Chartreuse.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add gin, St. Germain, yellow Chartreuse and half a lime.
3. Shake and strain into a chilled coupe.

cocktails.name: The Cheshire Cat
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward brandy cocktail that balances the herbal notes of rosemary with the deep complexity of Cognac and Scotch. Subtle hints of cherry and cinnamon provide a warm, aromatic finish, making it an ideal choice for slow sipping.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Gently muddle the fresh rosemary sprig in the bottom of a mixing glass to release its aromatic oils.
2. Add the Cognac, Scotch Whiskey, Cherry Heering, Punt e Mes, and cinnamon syrup to the mixing glass.
3. Fill the glass with ice and stir well for about 20-30 seconds until properly chilled and diluted.
4. Strain the mixture into a rocks glass over a large ice cube or fresh ice.
5. Express the oils from a lemon peel over the drink and discard the peel or use it as garnish.
6. Garnish with a fresh rosemary sprig and a cinnamon stick for a fragrant presentation.

cocktails.name: The Haole
cocktails.description: A bright and tropical highball that captures the essence of a summer afternoon. This refreshing blend features white rum and bianco vermouth accented by sweet pineapple and zesty lemon, topped with sparkling ginger ale for a spicy, effervescent kick.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a Collins glass with ice to chill it down.
2. In a cocktail shaker, combine the white rum, bianco vermouth, pineapple syrup, and lemon juice.
3. Add ice to the shaker and shake vigorously for about 10 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into the prepared Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
5. Top the glass with ginger ale and give it a very gentle stir to combine the flavors without losing carbonation.
6. Garnish with a fresh pineapple wedge.

cocktails.name: The Ridgwell
cocktails.description: A bold and layered whiskey cocktail that bridges the gap between a Manhattan and a Bramble. The combination of Bourbon and Rye provides a sturdy base, while the bittersweet notes of Punt e Mes and Strucchi Bitter are softened by a touch of blackberry liqueur.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine the Bourbon, Rye Whisky, Punt e Mes, Strucchi Bitter (or Campari), and Creme de Mure in a tin with ice.
2. Add the dashes of Angostura and Orange bitters.
3. Throw 5-6 times.
4. Strain the drink into a chilled coupe glass.
5. Garnish with a fresh blackberry dropped into the glass or on a cocktail pick.

cocktails.name: The Slope
cocktails.description: A sophisticated, spirit-forward cocktail that offers a perfect balance between the spice of rye whiskey, the herbal bitterness of Punt e Mes, and the stone-fruit sweetness of apricot brandy.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine Rye Whisky, Punt e Mes, Apricot Brandy, and Angostura bitters in a mixing glass.
2. Fill the mixing glass with ice cubes.
3. Stir gently for about 30 seconds until the drink is well-chilled and properly diluted.
4. Strain the mixture into the chilled coupe glass.
5. Garnish with a dried apricot.

cocktails.name: Three Dots and a Dash
cocktails.description: A classic Tiki masterpiece created by Don the Beachcomber during WWII. Its name represents the Morse code for 'Victory' (V), featuring a complex blend of rums and exotic spices.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine Rhum Agricole, aged rum, Falernum, allspice dram, lime juice, orange juice, honey syrup, and bitters in a cocktail shaker.
2. Fill the shaker with plenty of ice.
3. Shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Strain the contents into a tiki mug or glass filled with fresh crushed ice.
5. Garnish with three maraschino cherries and a pineapple wedge to represent the name.

cocktails.name: Tiger's Milk
cocktails.description: This is a rich, old-school cocktail often compared to eggnog or a boozy milkshake.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Shake all ingredients with ice.
2. Strain into an ice-filled glass.
3. Garnish with a pinch of freshly grated nutmeg.

cocktails.name: Tintoretto
cocktails.description: A Venetian classic, this cocktail is a vibrant variation of the Bellini. It pairs the crisp bubbles of Prosecco with the tart, ruby-red essence of fresh pomegranate juice.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour the chilled pomegranate juice into a chilled flute or cocktail glass.
2. Gently top with chilled Prosecco.
3. Stir very lightly and carefully with a bar spoon to combine without losing the carbonation.
4. Serve immediately while cold.

cocktails.name: Tipperary
cocktails.description: Irish whiskey stirred with green Chartreuse and sweet vermouth.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice.
2. Stir well.
3. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: Toasted Almond
cocktails.description: A variation of this cocktail with vodka is called the "Roasted Toasted Almond".
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add amaretto, coffee liqueur and cream.
3. Shake and strain into a rocks glass.

cocktails.name: Tom & Cherry
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and vibrant twist on a gin sour, featuring the botanical richness of Old Tom Gin paired with deep cherry notes and a hint of bitter complexity.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add Old Tom Gin, Cherry Heering, Maraschino liqueur, cherry juice, grapefruit juice, and Strucchi bitter into a cocktail shaker.
2. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
3. Fine strain the mixture into the chilled glass.
4. Garnish with a fresh or brandied cherry if desired.

cocktails.name: Tom and Jerry
cocktails.description: A legendary warm holiday punch that serves as a creamy, spiced embrace during the winter season.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Separate the egg white from the yolk and beat them in separate bowls until the whites are stiff and yolks are creamy.
2. Gently fold the egg whites into the yolks in an Irish coffee glass or mug.
3. Add simple syrup, dark rum, and cognac to the egg mixture.
4. Fill the rest of the glass with hot milk while stirring gently to combine.
5. Garnish with a generous dusting of freshly grated nutmeg.

cocktails.name: Tom Collins
cocktails.description: A timeless IBA classic, this refreshing highball perfectly balances the sweetness of Old Tom Gin with crisp citrus and sparkling water.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a Collins glass with plenty of ice cubes.
2. Pour the Old Tom gin, fresh lemon juice, and simple syrup directly into the glass.
3. Top up the glass with chilled soda water.
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon to integrate the ingredients without losing carbonation.
5. Garnish with a lemon slice and a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Tommy's Margarita
cocktails.description: A simplified margarita using agave syrup instead of orange liqueur.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add tequila, lime juice, and agave syrup into a shaker with ice.
2. Shake well.
3. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
4. Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Tootsie Roll
cocktails.description: This nice and mild shot is an attempt to recall the famous "Tootsie Roll" candy. The recipe here is for 3–4 shots.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
2. Pour coffee liqueur and orange juice.
3. Add vodka if you want to make it stronger.
4. Shake well and strain into a shooter.

cocktails.name: Trinidad Sour
cocktails.description: Bitters-heavy sour with rye and orgeat for balance.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
2. Shake well.
3. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: Tropic Dream
cocktails.description: A delicious non-alcoholic summer beverage.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Put some ice, a banana and several strawberries into a blender.
2. Add pineapple juice and coconut syrup.
3. Blend until smooth, and pour into a hurricane glass.
4. Top with whipped cream, and garnish with a strawberry.

cocktails.name: Tropical Bananarama
cocktails.description: A Bananarama cocktail is a tropical, fruit-forward drink that typically features banana liqueur or purée as its primary flavour. Because it is a modern creation, recipes vary significantly depending on the desired profile.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add ice and all liquid ingredients to a blender.
2. Add a fresh banana.
3. Blend until silky smooth.
4. Pour into a hurricane glass and garnish with a fresh banana slice.

cocktails.name: Tropical Queen
cocktails.description: An elegant and exotic gin-based delight that balances the botanical notes of gin with creamy coconut and a warm hint of cinnamon. Fresh citrus and grapefruit juices add a vibrant, refreshing finish perfect for a sunset escape.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add gin, coconut liqueur, cinnamon syrup, simple syrup, lime juice, grapefruit juice, and coconut water into a cocktail shaker.
2. Fill the shaker with 150g of ice.
3. Shake vigorously for about 10-15 seconds until well-chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into the chilled cocktail glass.
5. Garnish with a cinnamon stick for a fragrant tropical aroma.

cocktails.name: Tropical Sangria
cocktails.description: A light and effervescent twist on the classic sangria. This refreshing pitcher drink features crisp white wine and coconut notes, macerated with fresh orange, kiwi, and strawberries for a colorful, shareable summer treat.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Slice the orange and kiwi into rounds or wedges, and hull the strawberries.
2. In a large pitcher, combine the fruit pieces with coconut liqueur, white wine, and simple syrup.
3. Stir gently and let it sit in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
4. When ready to serve, add 150g of ice to the pitcher.
5. Top with soda water and stir briefly to combine.
6. Pour into glasses, ensuring each serve gets a portion of the fresh fruit.

cocktails.name: Tuxedo
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and complex dry gin martini variation from the late 19th century. The addition of maraschino liqueur and a hint of absinthe creates a herbal, slightly sweet profile that is both elegant and timeless.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add Old Tom gin, dry vermouth, maraschino liqueur, absinthe, and orange bitters into a mixing glass filled with ice.
2. Stir the mixture well for about 30 seconds to achieve the perfect dilution and temperature.
3. Strain the liquid into the chilled cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with a maraschino cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

cocktails.name: Vacation in Jamaica
cocktails.description: A rich, creamy rum drink featuring Gold Rum, Coconut Liqueur, and Caramel Syrup. It is dessert-like, smooth, and indulgent, offering a tropical escape in a glass.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Place the gold rum, coconut liqueur, caramel syrup, apple juice, heavy cream, and banana into a blender.
2. Add the ice (150g) to the mixture.
3. Blend until the consistency is smooth and creamy.
4. Pour the contents into a chilled coupe glass.
5. Garnish with coconut flakes, a banana slice, and a sprig of fresh mint.

cocktails.name: Vampiro
cocktails.description: A vibrant and spicy Mexican-style cocktail. It is a savory blend of tequila and fruit juices, enhanced with honey, onion, and chili for a complex, bold kick.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add tequila blanco, tomato juice, and orange juice into a shaker.
2. Squeeze the juice from half a lime into the shaker.
3. Add the honey, finely chopped onion, and slices of red chili pepper.
4. Add a few drops of Worcestershire sauce and a pinch of salt.
5. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously.
6. Strain the mixture into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
7. Garnish with a lime wedge and a whole red chili pepper.

cocktails.name: Ve.n.to
cocktails.description: An elegant Grappa-based sour that beautifully balances the intensity of the spirit with the soothing notes of chamomile and honey syrup.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add the grappa, lemon juice, honey syrup, and chamomile cordial into a shaker.
2. If desired, add an egg white for a silkier texture.
3. Fill the shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled.
4. Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
5. Garnish with a lemon twist and a few fresh grapes.

cocktails.name: Vegas Bomb
cocktails.description: A sweet and energetic bomb shot combining whisky, peach schnapps and Red Bull.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour half a can of Red Bull into a pub glass.
2. Make a shot of rye whisky and peach schnapps, and drop it into the glass with the Red Bull.
3. Drink quickly.

cocktails.name: Vesper
cocktails.description: James Bond's martini with gin, vodka, and Lillet Blanc.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add gin, vodka, and Lillet Blanc into a shaker with ice.
2. Shake well.
3. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: Vieux Carré
cocktails.description: New Orleans classic combining rye, cognac, vermouth, and Benedictine.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice.
2. Stir well.
3. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
4. Garnish with a lemon twist.

cocktails.name: Virgin Bananarama
cocktails.description: A Bananarama cocktail is a tropical, fruit-forward drink that typically features banana liqueur or purée as its primary flavour. Because it is a modern creation, recipes vary significantly depending on the desired profile.
cocktails.instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients in a blender with ice and blend until smooth.

cocktails.name: Virgin Colada
cocktails.description: A non-alcoholic variation of the "Piña Colada".
cocktails.instructions:
1. Put some crushed ice into a blender.
2. Add coconut milk and pineapple juice.
3. Blend until smooth, and pour into a hurricane glass.
4. Top with whipped cream, and garnish with a pineapple wedge and a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: Virgin Mary
cocktails.description: A non-alcoholic version of the "Bloody Mary" cocktail. It is also called the "Bloody Shame", "Bloody Virgin" or "Bloody Barbara".
cocktails.instructions:
1. Put ice cubes into a highball glass.
2. Add Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, salt and black pepper.
3. Pour tomato juice and the juice of a quarter lemon.
4. Stir gently and garnish with a celery stalk or lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: Virgin Sangria
cocktails.description: A refreshing non-alcoholic take on the classic Sangria. This vibrant mocktail combines deep grape and crisp apple flavors with a splash of citrus, topped with sparkling soda for a light, festive finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a goblet glass with ice.
2. Pour the grape juice, apple juice, orange juice, lime juice, and simple syrup into the glass.
3. Stir gently to combine the juices.
4. Top with soda water.
5. Garnish with slices of lemon, orange, and apple for a fruity presentation.

cocktails.name: Virginia
cocktails.description: A smooth and tropical delight that brings the beach to your glass. The creamy notes of coconut liqueur blend perfectly with the tartness of cranberry and lime for a balanced, exotic escape.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice.
2. Add the coconut liqueur (or coconut rum), cranberry juice, and fresh lime juice.
3. Stir well to ensure the flavors are thoroughly mixed.
4. Garnish with a fresh lime wedge on the rim.

cocktails.name: Vodka Buck
cocktails.description: Vodka and ginger beer built over ice with a bright lime kick.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a copper mug with ice.
2. Add vodka and lime juice.
3. Top with ginger beer and gently stir.
4. Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Vodka Martini
cocktails.description: This is a vodka-based variation of the Martini cocktail.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
2. Add 60ml of vodka and 15ml of dry vermouth.
3. Stir and strain into a cocktail glass.
4. Squeeze a lemon peel into the drink and garnish with a green olive.

cocktails.name: Vodka Rickey
cocktails.description: A quintessential highball that defines crisp simplicity. This variation of the classic Rickey swap spirits for vodka, resulting in a clean, bubbly, and incredibly refreshing drink with a sharp citrus kick.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour in the vodka and lime juice.
3. Top the glass with chilled soda water.
4. Stir briefly to combine.
5. Garnish with a fresh lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Ward 8
cocktails.description: A classic whiskey cocktail with citrus and a touch of grenadine.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add 60ml of rye whiskey, 15ml of lemon juice, 15ml of orange juice and a dash of grenadine.
3. Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with a cherry.

cocktails.name: Washington Apple
cocktails.description: A crisp mix of rye whiskey, apple liqueur and cranberry juice.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
2. Add 60ml of rye whiskey and 60ml of apple liqueur.
3. Add about 60ml of cranberry juice to the top.

cocktails.name: Water Moccasin
cocktails.description: Named after the venomous snake, this shooter blends peach schnapps with rye whiskey and citrus.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add 30ml of peach schnapps, 30ml of rye whiskey, 15ml of lemon juice and 15ml of simple syrup.
3. Pour a dash of triple sec or another orange liqueur.
4. Shake well and strain into shot glasses.

cocktails.name: Weng Weng
cocktails.description: A potent Filipino party drink combining many spirits with juices and grenadine.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Put some ice into a Collins glass.
2. Pour 10ml of vodka, 10ml of gin, 10ml of white rum, 10ml of scotch, 10ml of bourbon 10ml of of tequila, 10ml of triple sec, 10ml of brandy, and 10ml of coconut rum..
3. Fill with equal parts orange juice and pineapple juice to the top.
4. Add a dash of grenadine.
5. Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry.

cocktails.name: Whiskey Rebellion
cocktails.description: Whiskey and Pimm's combine with citrus and syrup for a refreshing twist.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Pour 37.5ml of rye whiskey and 30ml of Pimm's No. 1into a cocktail shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add 15ml of lemon juice and 15ml of simple syrup.
3. Shake well and strain into a rocks glass over ice cubes.
4. Garnish with a lemon wedge.

cocktails.name: Whiskey Sour
cocktails.description: Classic bourbon sour optionally enriched with egg white.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add bourbon, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white into a shaker without ice.
2. Dry shake.
3. Add ice and shake again.
4. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
5. Garnish with an orange slice and a maraschino cherry.

cocktails.name: White Christmas Martini
cocktails.description: A festive and creamy spirit-forward cocktail that blends smooth vanilla vodka with a refreshing peppermint kick. This elegant drink is perfectly balanced with half-and-half for a velvety texture, making it a sophisticated choice for holiday celebrations.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add the vanilla vodka, peppermint schnapps, and half-and-half into a cocktail shaker.
2. Fill the shaker with 150g of ice cubes.
3. Shake vigorously for about 15 seconds until the outside of the shaker feels very cold.
4. Strain the mixture into the chilled cocktail glass.
5. Garnish with a peppermint candy on the rim or dropped inside.

cocktails.name: White Lady
cocktails.description: A crisp and sophisticated classic gin sour. The bright citrus notes of lemon and the orange sweetness of triple sec create a clean, refreshing profile with a beautiful silky finish.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine the gin, triple sec, and fresh lemon juice in a cocktail shaker.
2. Fill the shaker with ice cubes.
3. Shake vigorously.
4. Fine-strain the mixture into a chilled cocktail glass.

cocktails.name: White Negroni
cocktails.description: A modern floral twist on the traditional Negroni. Substituting sweet vermouth and Campari with Lillet Blanc and Suze, this cocktail offers a unique herbal bitterness and a clear, golden hue.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Combine gin, Suze, and Lillet Blanc in a mixing glass filled with ice.
2. Stir until well chilled and properly diluted.
3. Strain into a rock glass.
4. Garnish with a fresh orange slice or zest.

cocktails.name: White Russian
cocktails.description: A rich, creamy classic cocktail that perfectly balances the kick of vodka with the sweetness of coffee liqueur, topped with a velvety layer of fresh cream.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a rocks glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour the vodka and coffee liqueur over the ice.
3. Gently pour the cream on top so it swirls into the dark liquid.
4. Stir lightly if desired, or serve layered for a striking visual effect.

cocktails.name: Wizard of Oz
cocktails.description: An enchanting tropical drink that combines coconut and melon liqueurs with a double punch of citrus juices for a refreshing, emerald-hued escape.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a collins glass with ice.
2. Add the coconut liqueur and melon liqueur to the glass.
3. Pour in the orange juice and pineapple juice.
4. Stir the ingredients together until well chilled.
5. Garnish with an orange slice and a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Woo Woo
cocktails.description: A vibrant and fruity party favorite that blends vodka and peach schnapps with crisp cranberry juice for a smooth, easy-drinking experience.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour the vodka, peach schnapps, and cranberry juice into the glass.
3. Stir the mixture thoroughly to combine and chill.
4. Garnish with a fresh lime wedge and serve.

cocktails.name: Writer's Coffee
cocktails.description: A rich coffee cocktail with dark rum, Kahlua and maraschino liqueur.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Shake all ingredients with ice.
2. Strain into a rock glass
3. Express the oils from the orange zest and put it into the glass.

cocktails.name: Yamabuki
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and harmonious blend where the depth of Japanese whisky meets the herbal sweetness of Bianco Vermouth and Amaro Montenegro. This cocktail offers a perfectly structured balance of citrus brightness and bittersweet complexity.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add the Japanese whisky, Bianco Vermouth, Amaro Montenegro, and orange bitters into a mixing glass filled with ice.
2. Stir gently for about 20-30 seconds until well-chilled.
3. Strain the mixture into the chilled glass.
4. Garnish with a fresh lemon twist.

cocktails.name: Yellow Bird
cocktails.description: An IBA official all-day cocktail combining white rum, Galliano, triple sec and lime.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a shaker with ice cubes.
2. Add 30ml of white rum, 15ml of Galliano, 15ml of triple sec and half a lime.
3. Shake and strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice.

cocktails.name: Yo Ho
cocktails.description: A refreshing and effervescent long drink that captures the spirit of the Mediterranean. It combines the crispness of white rum with zesty Limoncello and sparkling lemon tonic for an easy-sipping summer experience.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Fill a Collins glass with plenty of ice.
2. Pour the white rum and Limoncello over the ice.
3. Top up the glass with lemon tonic.
4. Stir gently with a bar spoon to combine the ingredients without losing carbonation.
5. Garnish with a fresh orange slice.

cocktails.name: Zombie
cocktails.description: Potent tiki classic blending multiple rums, citrus, and spice.
cocktails.instructions:
1. Add all ingredients except the overproof rum into a blender with ice and blend briefly.
2. Pour into a tall glass.
3. Float the overproof rum on top.
4. Garnish with a mint sprig and a cherry.

ingredients.name: 7-Up
ingredients.description: 7 Up (stylised as 7up outside of the U.S.) is a brand of lemon-lime flavoured, non-caffeinated soft drink.

ingredients.name: Absinthe
ingredients.description: Absinthe is an anise-forward spirit distilled with wormwood and other botanicals, typically 45–74% ABV. It is traditionally diluted with water to unlock its louche haze. Nicknamed the green fairy and linked to 19th-century artists.

ingredients.name: Absolut Citron
ingredients.description: Citrus-flavored vodka from Absolut in Åhus, Sweden, about 40% ABV. Bright lemon character lifts cosmopolitans and other citrus cocktails. Owned by Pernod Ricard.

ingredients.name: Absolut Vodka
ingredients.description: Swedish winter wheat vodka from Åhus bottled around 40% ABV. Known for a clean, neutral profile and consistent quality. Popular base for countless cocktails worldwide.

ingredients.name: Advocaat
ingredients.description: Advocaat is a rich Dutch egg liqueur with sweet custard notes and 14–20% ABV. Try it in a Snowball or Bombardino.

ingredients.name: Agave Syrup
ingredients.description: Agave syrup is a honey-like sweetener made from blue agave and related plants. It has a mellow caramel sweetness and dissolves quickly in cold drinks. Common in margaritas and other tequila cocktails.

ingredients.name: Aged Rum
ingredients.description: Rum aged in oak for deeper caramel and spice notes, typically around 40% ABV. Made from molasses or sugarcane juice. Smooth sipper that also suits Old Fashioned-style drinks.

ingredients.name: Ale
ingredients.description: Ale is a malty, fruity beer around 4–6% ABV. Enjoy it in a Shandy or Snakebite.

ingredients.name: Allspice
ingredients.description: Warm spice with clove, cinnamon, and nutmeg notes often used in tiki syrups and punches.

ingredients.name: Allspice Dram
ingredients.description: Allspice-flavored liqueur around 22% ABV used in tiki cocktails.

ingredients.name: Almond (Orgeat) Syrup
ingredients.description: Almond syrup, often known as orgeat, is a sweet, nutty syrup made from almonds, sugar, and orange flower water. It adds a creamy, aromatic quality to tropical and tiki cocktails. Its subtle nuttiness balances citrus and rum, making it essential in drinks like the Mai Tai.

ingredients.name: Amaretto
ingredients.description: Amaretto is an Italian almond liqueur at 21–28% ABV with sweet, nutty flavor. Use it in an Amaretto Sour or Godfather.

ingredients.name: Amaro
ingredients.description: Amaro is a bitter-sweet Italian herbal liqueur produced by infusing alcohol with a blend of botanicals, including herbs, roots, spices, and citrus peels, then sweetening it and aging the mixture.

ingredients.name: Amaro Montenegro
ingredients.description: Amaro Montenegro is a herbal Italian amaro from Bologna by Montenegro Srl., 23% ABV. Mix it in a Monte & Tonic or Paper Plane.

ingredients.name: Amaro Nonino
ingredients.description: Amaro Nonino is a bittersweet amaro from Nonino Distillatori at 35% ABV. Ideal in a Paper Plane or Black Manhattan.

ingredients.name: Amontillado Sherry
ingredients.description: Nutty, amber sherry that begins as fino before aging oxidatively, around 16–18% ABV. Dry with savory, toasted notes. Adds depth to cobblers and stirred cocktails.

ingredients.name: Angelica root
ingredients.description: Earthy, herbal root that adds dry bitterness to gins and aromatic bitters.

ingredients.name: Angostura Bitters
ingredients.description: Concentrated Trinidad bitters at 44.7% ABV made with gentian, herbs, and spices. Famous oversized label and closely guarded recipe. A few dashes add spice and bitterness to classics like the Old Fashioned or Manhattan.

ingredients.name: Anis
ingredients.description: Anis is a sweet anise-flavored liqueur, typically 20–40% ABV. Try it in an Anisette Sour or Spanish coffee.

ingredients.name: Anise
ingredients.description: Licorice-scented spice that brightens syrups, liqueurs, and garnishes.

ingredients.name: Anisette
ingredients.description: Sweet anise-flavored liqueur around 25% ABV. Clear and aromatic with licorice character. Served chilled, with coffee, or in pastis-style mixes.

ingredients.name: Aperol
ingredients.description: Aperol is a bright orange aperitif from Campari Group, 11% ABV, with bitter citrus and rhubarb notes. Perfect for an Aperol Spritz or Paper Plane.

ingredients.name: Apple
ingredients.description: Crisp, sweet-tart fruit used for juices, garnishes, and infusions. Adds fresh orchard aroma to cocktails.

ingredients.name: Apple Brandy
ingredients.description: Fruit brandy distilled from apples, typically 40–50% ABV. Offers baked-apple and spice notes from barrel aging. Great in Jack Rose-style cocktails.

ingredients.name: Apple Cider
ingredients.description: Apple cider is a crisp fermented apple drink at 4–6% ABV. Enjoy it in a Snakebite or Stone Fence.

ingredients.name: Apple Juice
ingredients.description: Sweet pressed apple juice with crisp acidity. Adds gentle fruitiness to punches and highballs. Works with rum, bourbon, and cider-inspired cocktails.

ingredients.name: Apple Liqueur
ingredients.description: Apple liqueur is a sweet apple spirit around 15–30% ABV. Shake it into an Appletini or Applejack cocktail.

ingredients.name: Apple Schnapps
ingredients.description: Apple schnapps is a tart apple spirit with roughly 15–25% ABV. Use it in an Apple Pie shot or Appletini.

ingredients.name: Applejack
ingredients.description: American apple spirit often blended with neutral grain, usually 40–50% ABV. Brings baked-apple flavor with subtle oak. Classic choice for Jack Roses and Old Fashioned riffs.

ingredients.name: Apricot Brandy
ingredients.description: Apricot-based brandy or liqueur with stone-fruit sweetness, usually 30–40% ABV. Adds jammy orchard notes to cocktails. Useful in sours and tiki drinks.

ingredients.name: Apricot Nectar
ingredients.description: Sweet, thick apricot juice blend that brings mellow stone-fruit flavor. Great for tiki drinks, spritzes, and punches.

ingredients.name: Ardbeg
ingredients.description: Islay single malt Scotch famed for intense peat smoke and maritime notes, typically around 46% ABV. Distilled on Islay’s south coast. Bold choice for Penicillin variations or neat sipping.

ingredients.name: Bacardi 151 Proof Rum
ingredients.description: Very high-proof rum at 75½% ABV once made by Bacardi. Powerful caramel and molasses notes suited to punches or flaming drinks. Handle carefully and dilute in cocktails.

ingredients.name: Baileys
ingredients.description: Baileys Irish Cream is a creamy liqueur by Diageo, 17% ABV, with chocolate and whiskey notes. Serve in a Mudslide or B-52.

ingredients.name: Banana
ingredients.description: Soft, sweet fruit with creamy texture used for smoothies and tiki garnishes. Works well in frozen cocktails or batched punches.

ingredients.name: Banana Liqueur
ingredients.description: Banana liqueur is a sweet banana spirit about 20–25% ABV. Mix it in a Banana Daiquiri or Dirty Banana.

ingredients.name: Banana Liqueur Green
ingredients.description: Vivid green banana liqueur with sweet tropical aroma around 20–25% ABV. Adds color and ripe banana notes to tiki drinks and dessert cocktails.

ingredients.name: Basil
ingredients.description: Basil is a fragrant herb with a sweet, slightly peppery flavor. It adds a fresh and aromatic note to both alcoholic and non-alcoholic cocktails. Common in summer drinks, it pairs especially well with gin, vodka, and citrus juices.

ingredients.name: Beef Bouillon
ingredients.description: Beef bouillon is a savory broth made by simmering beef with vegetables and seasonings. In cocktails, it is primarily used in savory drinks like the Bloody Bull, adding depth and umami richness. It can also enhance the complexity of creative culinary-style cocktails.

ingredients.name: Beer
ingredients.description: Beer is a carbonated malt beverage around 4–6% ABV with malty, hoppy notes. Pour it in a Michelada or Shandy.

ingredients.name: Benedictine
ingredients.description: French herbal liqueur around 40% ABV with honeyed sweetness and spice. Created by Alexandre Le Grand from a secret blend of botanicals. Essential in drinks like the Vieux Carré and Singapore Sling.

ingredients.name: Berentzen Apfel Korn
ingredients.description: Berentzen Apfelkorn is a German apple schnapps by Berentzen Group, 18% ABV. Enjoy it in an Apple Shot or Hot Apfel.

ingredients.name: Berries
ingredients.description: Mixed berries that deliver bright acidity and deep color. Perfect for muddling into spritzes, sangria, and berry sours.

ingredients.name: Bianco Vermouth
ingredients.description: Vermouth is an aromatized fortified wine around 15–18% ABV. Use it in a Martini or Negroni.

ingredients.name: Bittermens Boston Bittahs
ingredients.description: Citrus-forward bitters with grapefruit and hop notes. Brightens gin, rum, or tequila cocktails with gentle bitterness. Use a dash or two to add sparkle without heavy spice.

ingredients.name: Bitters
ingredients.description: Aromatic bitters are alcohol-based flavor concentrates infused with herbs and spices. Just a few dashes add bitterness, spice, and balance to cocktails. Keep them on the rail for Old Fashioneds, Manhattans, and sours.

ingredients.name: Bizon Grass Vodka
ingredients.description: Polish bison grass vodka (Żubrówka) around 37½–40% ABV flavored with aromatic sweet grass. Offers vanilla, almond, and herb notes. Great with apple juice or in refreshing highballs.

ingredients.name: Black Pepper
ingredients.description: Cracked peppercorn heat for savory cocktails or rimming a spicy Bloody Mary.

ingredients.name: Black Sambuca
ingredients.description: Dark anise liqueur with added licorice and spice, around 38% ABV. Richer and slightly bitter compared to white sambuca. Served as shots, with coffee, or flaming in cocktails.

ingredients.name: Black Tea
ingredients.description: Black tea is a strong, full-bodied tea with a rich, tannic flavor. It can be used as a base for tea cocktails or as an infused mixer with spirits. Its bold taste pairs well with whiskey, rum, and fruit liqueurs.

ingredients.name: Blackberry
ingredients.description: Juicy dark berry with sweet-tart flavor. Ideal for muddling into brambles or simmering into berry syrups.

ingredients.name: Blackberry Brandy
ingredients.description: Brandy or liqueur flavored with blackberries, typically 30–40% ABV. Sweet, jammy berry notes with a warming finish. Works in sours, cobblers, and dessert drinks.

ingredients.name: Blackberry Liqueur
ingredients.description: Blackberry liqueur offers rich berry sweetness at about 18–20% ABV. Use it in a Bramble or Blackberry Martini.

ingredients.name: Blackcurrant Cordial
ingredients.description: Sweet blackcurrant syrup with deep berry color and tangy sweetness. Dilute with soda or water for a refreshing base. Great for spritzes, punches, or zero-proof cocktails.

ingredients.name: Blackstrap Rum
ingredients.description: The third boiling of the sugar syrup yields dark, viscous blackstrap molasses, known for its robust flavor. The majority of sucrose from the original juice has crystallized and been removed. The caloric content of blackstrap molasses is mostly due to the small remaining sugar content.

ingredients.name: Blood Orange
ingredients.description: Deep red-fleshed orange with berry-like citrus flavor. Anthocyanin pigments give it a vivid hue that develops in cool nights. Great for adding color to sours and spritzes.

ingredients.name: Blue Curaçao
ingredients.description: Blue Curaçao is a blue-dyed orange liqueur, 20–25% ABV, with bitter citrus flavor. Star of the Blue Lagoon and Blue Hawaii.

ingredients.name: Blue Curaçao Syrup
ingredients.description: Blue Curaçao syrup delivers sweet orange flavor with a vivid blue hue. It mimics the taste of curaçao liqueur without alcohol. Great for colorful tropical cocktails and lemonades.

ingredients.name: Blueberry Schnapps
ingredients.description: Blueberry schnapps is a fruity schnapps around 15–25% ABV. Try it in a Berry Kamikaze or Blueberry Martini.

ingredients.name: Boiling Water
ingredients.description: Freshly boiled water used to dilute or build hot drinks. Essential for toddies, teas, and grogs. Use just off the boil to avoid scalding spirits or citrus.

ingredients.name: Borage
ingredients.description: Borage has a crisp, cucumber-like flavor that brings refreshing aroma to spritzes and highballs. The star-shaped blue flowers make striking garnishes for gin or tequila drinks. Muddle gently or float the blossoms to keep their delicate look.

ingredients.name: Bourbon
ingredients.description: American whiskey made primarily from corn and aged in new charred oak, usually 40–50% ABV. Offers caramel, vanilla, and baking spice notes. Staple for Old Fashioneds, Manhattans, and many classics.

ingredients.name: Brandy
ingredients.description: Distilled wine spirit aged in oak, commonly 36–60% ABV. Smooth notes of dried fruit, vanilla, and oak. Versatile for sipping neat or mixing in Sidecars and punch.

ingredients.name: Brown Sugar
ingredients.description: Brown sugar is fine, moist cane sugar with molasses added back for color and flavor. It dissolves quickly and brings caramel notes to syrups and hot drinks. Light and dark varieties offer different molasses intensity.

ingredients.name: Butter
ingredients.description: Butter is churned dairy fat that adds richness and a silky mouthfeel. A small knob can soften boozy edges or balance spices in warm cocktails.

ingredients.name: Butterginger candy bar
